alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cape May; Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:55AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Atlantic, southeastern Cumberland and northwestern Cape May Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 255 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fortesque, or 12 miles south of Millville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laurel Lake, Woodbine, Estell Manor, Corbin City, Newport, Mauricetown, Belleplain Forest, Leesburg, Port Norris, Dividing Creek, Green Creek, Dennisville, Bricksboro, Goshen, Port Elizabeth, Bivalve, Fortesque, Eldora, Villas and Whitesboro-Burleigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
